reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here five nights at the beginning of Feb. Since we were there over a weekend, it felt like we had the place to ourselves! Every time we returned it seemed like all the staff came out to greet us! Checkin was a little pained on account of our non-spanish, and the checkin girl's poor english. Still, everything was sorted and we had a great stay.
reviews.title: Really nice hotel

reviews.text: I think the best part has to be the club lounge. Really, I'm surprised they don't use this for "paying" guests - the terrace is amazing!
reviews.title: New, Good location, nice staff

reviews.text: Two tips: 1. If you're looking for the hotel on a map, it's on the corner of Avenida Paseo de la Reforma and Calle Copenhague. Closest Metro is Insurgentes, 5 mins walk away.
reviews.title: Brand new, Great Hotel... Still working out the kinks..

reviews.text: 2. If you ask the Concierge for a taxi, make sure you tell him you want a normal "radio taxi", otherwise they'll use the hotel car which is more expensive.
reviews.title: Small but perfectly formed!

reviews.text: I liked this hotel a lot. It has a pretty interior, and everything worked well (except for the wet sauna, which was out of order).
reviews.title: Offered everything I could want

reviews.text: I thought the location was ideal. The hotel is surrounded by restaurants, and the U.S. Embassy is across the street.
reviews.title: My favorite hotel in Mexico City
Marriott Reforma is a gem
reviews.text: Hotel staff is very attentive to your needs.

If you're there on a Sunday, give yourself the morning to take a bike ride on the otherwise busy Paseo de la Reforma. It's closed off from 7 am or so to 2 pm to vehicles. You can "rent" a bike at a kiosk in front of the hotel beginning 9 am. There's no charge, you only have to provide two forms of ID. The ride is prettier heading out left. Make sure to look for the man selling fresh squeezed orange juice from a cart on the sidewalk within a couple of blocks of the hotel. It was the best damn orange juice I've ever had in my life.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have made this my default hotel in MEX. Elite Benefits are great with Club Access and included Internet. Great location and many restaurant options Mansion, Angus, etc.
reviews.title: Recommended!
Lovely Hotel, Bad Restaurants
reviews.text: This place was recently renovated. The result is an extremely posh hotel with lovely amenities in a nice part of town. The executive suite on the 16th floor is very nice. It's like having your own big living room equipped with an outdoor deck. The health club on the 5th floor is also good, and the rooms are nice, albeit too dry. My air conditioner was highly suspect, but the rooms are still beautiful. My one criticism would be the restaurants in the hotel. They look very pretty, but don't be fooled -- the food is mediocre at best. Anyone who thinks otherwise doesn't know what good food tastes like. I recommend Angus, a restaurant only 100 yards from the hotel. Now Angus is usually surrounded by pimps and girls selling lapdances, but the food is good. And the girls at Angus are hot. As long as you walk quickly and are polite, nobody will bug you.

reviews.title: First Class hotel
reviews.text: In general, the area is great. It's on Reforma, only a block away from the legendary Angel statue. The "Zona Rosa" or pink zone is a good area. It is a hangout for homosexuals, so don't be too surprised if you see a few guys displaying serious PDAs. In the area behind the hotel are many shops and cafes, etc. I felt safe here, but watch yourself. As I said, there are pimps and guys looking to sell you something. Just make sure you are around other people and you should be fine. You can also find rock clubs back here. I
Comfortable, quite rooms. IPOD docking stations on alarm clock. 2 GREAT restaurants with first class service.
reviews.title: WONDERFUL!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights on business. GREAT hotel--not one complaint. Super clean, perfect service, nice rooms, comfy bed, gorgeous facilities from lobby to gym to spa to Executive lounge. Would definitely stay again. Located in a great place too--plenty of restaurants around the corner (and in a safe area to walk) but room service wasnt bad either. You won't be disappointed!
reviews.title: Could be better

reviews.text: For a brand new hotel the facilities are excellent but the tour operator they use for their trips is poor both in quailty of coaches and guides. Nice hotel as it is new but be aware that building work is taking place on both sides of the hotel. Executive room nice to have use of but is open season to local people after 8o'clock who get access to a service that guests pay extra for free
reviews.title: Brand new Marriott, Great Location, Excellent Service

reviews.text: This hotel was very new, and very nice. Clean, modern, efficient, it is a good high-end Marriott which is much better than a Marriott in the US at a similar price point.
reviews.title: Very nice new Marriott, great locatin, reasonable price
Marriott Reforma Hotel
reviews.text: Room was spacious, spotless and well appointed, as was the bathroom.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only stayed a night so can't comment much on restaurant, but breakfast wasn't exceptional by any means. For a really good hotel beakfast in Mexico City, try the huevos rancheros at the Sheraton Maria Isabel.
reviews.title: Great location and service in a modern hotel

reviews.text: Also can't comment on other facilities such as fitness room, pool etc.
reviews.title: What a pity

reviews.text: Usual gripe: paying for internet access; how come hotels charge us for this essentially fixed-cost item? Answer: because they can. Why don't they charge extra for running water and lighting? One day this will seem as unacceptable as smoking on planes.
reviews.title: Fantastic but not a great view
